Multimedia.title: Lesson Trailer: "Females Singing to be Heard"
Multimedia.description:
A brief overview of our lesson "Females singing to be heard: Challenging long-held assumptions about birdsong through data visualization," providing broader context from two authors of the study this lesson is based on.
Full Lesson Plan: https://www.galacticpolymath.com/less...​
Sign up for emails to learn about all our free lesson plans and learning tools: https://galacticpolymath.us8.list-man...​
After you teach it, we would love your feedback: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FA...​
Funded by the Animal Behaviour Society (https://www.animalbehaviorsociety.org...​)
Multimedia.lessonRelevance: A brief overview of the lesson, providing broader context from two authors of the study this lesson is based on.
Multimedia.keywords: histograms, scatter plots, data literacy, interdisciplinary lessons, STEM, STEAM

Multimedia.title: How to solve the Polymath Puzzle from the "Females Sing" lesson
Multimedia.description:
Part of the GP lesson "Females singing to be heard: Challenging long-held assumptions about birdsong through data visualization". 
https://www.galacticpolymath.com/lessons/1
This video explains strategies for solving this Polymath Puzzle–a graph with labels encoded using an alphabetic shift. By taking a real scientific figure and turning it into a puzzle, this activity provides a strong hook for students to engage in a lesson on scatter plots which builds key data literacy skills which are important for making informed decisions in the digital era.
Multimedia.lessonRelevance: Explains strategies for solving the Polymath Puzzle. This is an engagement hook that blends a simple alphabetic shift puzzle with a data literacy challenge.
Multimedia.keywords: STEAM education,STEAM lessons,STEM education,bird song,birdsong,cipher,data literacy,histogram,interdisciplinary lesson,scatter plots

Multimedia.title: How to read the deciphered scatter plot
Multimedia.description:
Part of the GP lesson "Females singing to be heard: Challenging long-held assumptions about birdsong through data visualization". 
https://www.galacticpolymath.com/lessons/1
This video guides students through how to read a scatter plot and how this visualization tells a story. Specifically, it guides students with how to read and interpret axis labels and notice patterns in the data to hypothesize about its meaning.
Multimedia.lessonRelevance: Provides scaffolding for understanding how to read this graph (which comes straight from a recent study) and notice patterns.
Multimedia.keywords: STEAM education,STEAM lessons,STEM education,bird song,birdsong,cipher,data literacy,histogram,interdisciplinary lesson,scatter plots

Multimedia.title: Polymath Puzzle Reveal—Is the graph about birds, spiders, whales,...?
Multimedia.description:
Part of the GP lesson "Females singing to be heard: Challenging long-held assumptions about birdsong through data visualization". 
https://www.galacticpolymath.com/lessons/1
The study's lead author, Dr. Matthew Wilkins, explains how the data was collected, providing footage and stories from the fieldwork with barn swallows, and provides broader context for why the study's findings are important for our understanding of animal communication.
Multimedia.lessonRelevance: Explains what this graph is actually about, providing background on female song in barn swallows and the field work employed to study it.
Multimedia.keywords: STEAM lessons,STEM education,STEAM education,interdisciplinary lesson,data literacy,scatter plots,cipher,bird song,birdsong,histogram

Multimedia.title: Scatter plots or histograms? Why data visualization is important
Multimedia.description:
Part of the GP lesson "Females singing to be heard: Challenging long-held assumptions about birdsong through data visualization". 
https://www.galacticpolymath.com/lessons/1
This video highlights the vital importance of data literacy. It explains that during peer review, a scientist requested that the scatter plot in the Polymath Puzzle (based on an actual figure in the scientific paper) should have been a histogram. Next, the students will be asked to use the raw study data to create a histogram and decide which is actually a better way to visualize the study findings.
Multimedia.lessonRelevance: This video highlights the vital importance of data literacy. It asks students to compare two different types of graph and decide which is a better visual for demonstrating the main findings of the study.
Multimedia.keywords: STEAM lessons,STEM education,STEAM education,interdisciplinary lesson,data literacy,scatter plots,cipher,Nearly Impossible Task,NIT,bird song,birdsong,histogram

Multimedia.title: Connections between dot plots and histograms (with sound)
Multimedia.description: This animation was developed to show the logical connections between a dot plot, a binned dot plot, and a histogram. The goal is for students to have a clearer understanding of what these three types of graphs are showing and to convey how the same data can be represented in different ways. We hope the silly sound effects make this a little more interesting for students, but mute if not :)
Multimedia.lessonRelevance: This animation was developed to show the logical connections between a dot plot, a binned dot plot, and a histogram. The silly sounds are added for memorability.

Multimedia.title: Getting to know your data: Counting barn swallow songs
Multimedia.description:
This video demonstrates how to count barn swallow songs to generate the data examined in the "Females Singing to be Heard" lesson in the "Assumptions Matter" unit.
https://www.galacticpolymath.com/lessons/1 
The video supports Part 3 of the lesson, to deepen student engagement by showing by showing what the data actually represent in the real world.
Multimedia.lessonRelevance: This video demonstrates how to count barn swallow songs to generate the data examined.

Multimedia.title: Scientific Background: Female barn swallows sing
Multimedia.description:
A video related to the 2020 study by Wilkins, et al for the first time describing female song in one of the most widely researched songbird species. Until now, females were thought to sing the same song as males or not sing at all, neither of which is accurate.
This video provides extra background context for our lesson ""Females singing to be heard: Challenging long-held assumptions about birdsong through data visualization"". 
https://www.galacticpolymath.com/lessons/1
Paper: Wilkins MR, Odom KJ, Benedict L, Safran RJ (2020) ""Analysis of female song provides insight into the evolution of dimorphism in a widely studied songbird"" https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.03.28.013433v1
Multimedia.lessonRelevance: This video provides extra background context for the lesson. The video is not included in the lesson, but is provided for your background or if you want to use it in some way.
Multimedia.keywords: STEAM,science,birds,barn swallows,birdsong,female song,middle school math lessons
